artciles.q: WhicFrom given input-output pairs pattern recognition model should capture characteristics of the system?
artciles.description: From given input-output pairs pattern recognition model should be able to capture characteristics of the system & hence should be designed in that manner.

artciles.q: Let a(l), b(l) represent in input-output pairs, where “l” varies in natural range of no.s, then if a(l)=b(l)?
option: can be either auto or heteroassociation
artciles.description: When a(l)=b(l) problem is classified as autoassociation.

artciles.q: Let a(l), b(l) represent in input-output pairs, where “l” varies in natural range of no.s, then if a(l)=!b(l)
option: can be either auto or heteroassociation
artciles.description: When a(l) & b(l)are distinct, problem is classified as autoassociation.

artciles.q: The recalled output in pattern association problem depends on?
artciles.description: The recalled output in pattern association problem depends on both input & design of network.

artciles.q: If a(l) gives output b(l) & a’=a(l)+m,where m is small quantity & if a’ gives ouput b(l) then?
artciles.description: This follows from basic definition of accretive behaviour in neural.

artciles.q: If a(l) gives output b(l) & a’=a(l)+m,where m is small quantity & if a’ gives ouput b(l)+n then?
artciles.description: This follows from basic definition in neural.

artciles.q: Can system be both interpolative & accretive at same time?
artciles.description: System can’t exhibit both behaviour at same time. since these are based on different approach & algorithm.

artciles.q: What are 3 basic types of neural nets that form basic functional units amongi)feedforward ii) loop iii) recurrent iv) feedback v) combination of feed forward & back?
artciles.description: These form the basic functional units of neural nets.

artciles.q: Feedback networks are used for autoassociation & pattern storage?
artciles.description: Feedback networks are typically used for autoassociation & pattern storage.

artciles.q: Feedforward networks are also used for autoassociation & pattern storage?
artciles.description: Feedforward networks are used for pattern mapping.

artciles.q: What is the objective of perceptron learning?
option: adjust weight along with class identification
artciles.answer: adjust weight along with class identification
artciles.description: The objective of perceptron learning is to adjust weight along with class identification.

artciles.q: On what factor the number of outputs depends?
artciles.description: Number of outputs depends on number of classes.

artciles.q: In perceptron learning, what happens when input vector is correctly classified?
option: small adjustments in weight is done
large adjustments in weight is done
no adjustments in weight is done
artciles.answer: no adjustments in weight is done
artciles.description: No adjustments in weight is done, since input has been correctly classified which is the objective of the system

artciles.q: When two classes can be separated by a separate line, they are known as?
option: may be separable or inseparable, it depends on system
artciles.description: Linearly separable classes, functions can be separated by a line.

artciles.q: If two classes are linearly inseparable, can perceptron convergence theorem be applied?
artciles.description: Perceptron convergence theorem can only be applied, if and only if two classses are linearly separable.

artciles.q: Two classes are said to be inseparable when?
option: E there may exist straight lines that doesn’t touch each other
there may exist straight lines that can touch each other
there is only one straight line that separates them
artciles.answer: there is only one straight line that separates them
artciles.description: Linearly separable classes, functions can be separated by a line.

artciles.q: Is it necessary to set initial weights in prceptron convergence theorem to zero?
artciles.description: Initial setting of weights doesn’t affect perceptron convergence theorem

artciles.q: The perceptron convergence theorem is applicable for what kind of data?
artciles.description: The perceptron convergence theorem is applicable for both binary and bipolar input, output data.

artciles.q: w(m + 1) = w(m) + n(b(m) – s(m)) a(m), where b(m) is desired output, s(m) is actual output, a(m) is input vector and ‘w’ denotes weight, can this model be used for perceptron learning?
artciles.description: Gradient descent can be used as perceptron learning.

artciles.q: If e(m) denotes error for correction of weight then what is formula for error in perceptron learning model: w(m + 1) = w(m) + n(b(m) – s(m)) a(m), where b(m) is desired output, s(m) is actual output, a(m) is input vector and ‘w’ denotes weight
artciles.description: Error is difference between desired and actual output.
